meanings.definition: Cooked too long or too much.
meanings.sent1: The overcooked steak was tough and dry.
meanings.sent2: The chef accidentally overcooked the pasta, making it mushy.
meanings.sent3: The overcooked vegetables were so soft, they turned into a puree!
meanings.sent4: Her overcooked attempt at baking cookies left them as hard as rocks.
meanings.sent5: The smell of the overcooked chicken filled the kitchen with a burnt aroma.

meanings.sent1: The overcooked rice was sticky and inedible.
meanings.sent2: The cake was overcooked, resulting in a bitter taste.
meanings.sent3: The overcooked soup was so thick, it could be used as wallpaper paste!
meanings.sent4: His overcooked storytelling made the audience lose interest quickly.
meanings.sent5: The overcooked bacon was so charred, it set off the smoke alarm.
